revised_title: Development of Voltaic Electricity through Atmospheric Oxidation
tldr: The authors investigate the development of voltaic electricity through atmospheric oxidation using a copper plate and an aeration plate in an ammoniacal solution. They discover that the process involves the formation of cuprous oxide and the generation of a voltaic current, which can be controlled by adjusting the resistance in the circuit. The authors also compare their findings to the 'air-battery' described by Gladstone and Tribe in 1873.
